parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To make or bring low, humble, humiliate; pass: To be humbled. From tapeinos; to depress; figuratively, to humiliate.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular

str2: From perissos; to superabound, be in excess, be superfluous; also to cause to superabound or excel.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To initiate, instruct; pass: To be disciplined, learn (a lesson). From the base of musterion; to initiate, i.e. to teach.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To feed, satisfy, fatten. From chortos; to fodder, i.e. to gorge.
To be hungry, needy, desire earnestly. From the same as penes; to famish; figuratively, to crave.
From perissos; to superabound, be in excess, be superfluous; also to cause to superabound or excel.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From husteros; to be later, i.e. to be inferior; generally, to fall short.
